    31→"description":"Download Keepsafe to join the millions of people who have entrusted over a billion pictures to Keepsafe: the most popular photo locker and album vault app.

Keepsafe secures personal photos and videos by locking them down with PIN protection, fingerprint touch ID, and military-grade encryption. It’s the best place for storing your personal pictures and videos. With Keepsafe, you can protect your privacy, secure your photos, and save phone space.

Use Keepsafe for:
- Preserving special memories
- Storing family photos
- Protecting copies of your driver’s license, ID cards, and credit cards
- Organizing important documents

What makes Keepsafe different?
• Award-winning photo locker, with over 70 million users
• Beautiful design and UX. Easy to upload, view & organize photos
• Smooth scrolling for photo viewing on all devices

Basic Features:
- Phone and tablet support
- Simple interface
- Easy-to-use PIN pad access
- Photo backup
- Custom albums
- Full-screen and slideshow viewing for photos and videos
- Integrated camera for taking photos directly in Keepsafe
- Safe Send for sharing pictures for a limited time from Keepsafe
- Syncs images and videos in Keepsafe to all of your Keepsafe installations on any platform

Keepsafe Premium’s Exclusive Features:

Manage Your Photos
• Album Lock: Assign individual PIN codes to access particular albums
• Private Cloud: Stores up to 10,000 items in Keepsafe
• Space Saver: Compresses photos and saves originals to the Cloud
• Trash Recovery: Retrieves photos you’ve mistakenly deleted

Personalize Keepsafe
• Ad-Free: Keeps your photo-viewing experience distraction-free
• Custom Album Covers: Sets album thumbnails to a specific image

========================

Help & Support

Problems or questions?

Visit Keepsafe’s support site at https://support.getkeepsafe.com/hc/en-us
Send a ticket from inside Keepsafe (best for troubleshooting)
Contact us at support@getkeepsafe.com

========================


Keepsafe Premium Subscription

- Payment will be charged to iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase
- Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the period
- Length of subscriptions: one month & one year
- Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal
- Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase
- No cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during active subscription period
- Any unused portion of a free period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription.

========================

Vaultaire
Home Features Security Manifesto Compare

Vaultaire vs. The Rest

Most photo vault apps hide your files behind a PIN screen. Vaultaire encrypts them with AES-256-GCM so they can't be read even if someone pulls the raw data off your device. See how we compare.

Vaultaire vs Private Photo Vault

998K ratings
PIN protection over unencrypted files. No duress mode, no pattern lock, no zero-knowledge design.

Vaultaire vs Keepsafe

369K ratings
Requires account creation. Cloud-dependent. Claims encryption but stores files on their servers.

Vaultaire vs Privault

77K ratings
Calculator disguise UI. PIN-based access without true file-level encryption or duress protection.

Vaultaire vs SPV

68K ratings
Simple photo vault with PIN. No encryption architecture, no plausible deniability, no sharing.

Vaultaire vs Secret Photo Album

39K ratings
Basic album hiding behind passcode. Files sit unencrypted on disk, accessible with any file browser.

Vaultaire vs PV Secret Photo Album

30K ratings
Another PIN-protected gallery. No file encryption, no vault separation, no duress capabilities.

Vaultaire vs Calculator#

29K ratings
Disguised as a calculator app. Clever UI trick, but files remain unencrypted underneath.

Vaultaire vs Secret Photo Vault

27K ratings
Standard passcode lock on a photo album. No true encryption, no recovery phrase, no vault sharing.

Vaultaire vs Hide it Pro

24K ratings
Multi-purpose hiding app. Obscurity over security with no cryptographic file protection.

Vaultaire vs Safe Lock

24K ratings
PIN-locked photo vault with cloud backup. No individual file encryption, no duress features.

Vaultaire

There is no limitation. Any file can be stored and shared.

How many vaults can I have?

        .btn-primary:hover::before {
            transform: translateX(0);
        }

        .btn-primary:hover {
            background-color: var(--accent-dark);
            transform: translateY(-2px);
            box-shadow: 0 10px 30px rgba(31, 13, 119, 0.3);
        }

        .btn-secondary {
            background: transparent;
            border: 2px solid var(--text-dark);
            color: var(--text-dark);
        }

        .btn-secondary:hover {
            background: var(--surface-dark);
            border-color: var(--accent-dark);
        }

        /* ── Header / Nav ── */
        header {
            position: fixed;
            top: 0;
            left: 0;
            width: 100%;
            z-index: 1000;
            background: var(--header-bg);
            backdrop-filter: blur(12px);
            border-bottom: 1px solid var(--header-border);
            transition: background-color 240ms ease, border-color 240ms ease;
        }

        .nav-inner {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-between;
            align-items: center;
            height: 80px;
        }

        .logo {
            font-family: var(--font-display);
            font-weight: 700;
            font-size: 1.25rem;
            letter-spacing: 0.01em;
            color: var(--text-dark);
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 10px;
        }

        .logo .logo-mark {
            width: 28px;
            height: 28px;
            border-radius: 8px;
            display: block;
            box-shadow: 0 6px 14px color-mix(in srgb, var(--bg-dark) 68%, transparent 32%);
        }

        .logo .logo-mark--light {
            display: none;
        }

        :root[data-theme='light'] .logo .logo-mark--dark {
            display: none;
        }

        :root[data-theme='light'] .logo .logo-mark--light {
            display: block;
        }

        .logo span {
            color: var(--text-dark);
        }

        .nav-links {
            display: flex;
            gap: 32px;
        }

        .nav-links a {
            font-size: 0.9rem;
            text-transform: uppercase;
            letter-spacing: 0.1em;
            opacity: 0.8;
            position: relative;
        }

        .nav-links a::after {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            bottom: -5px;
            left: 0;
            width: 0;
            height: 2px;
            background: var(--accent-dark);
            transition: width 0.3s;
        }

        .nav-links a:hover::after {
            width: 100%;
        }

        .nav-cta {
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 12px;
        }

        .theme-toggle {
            border: 1px solid var(--header-border);
            background: var(--theme-button-bg);
            color: var(--theme-button-text);
            height: 44px;
            min-width: 44px;
            padding: 0 14px;
            border-radius: 999px;
            font: 600 0.82rem var(--font-body);
            display: inline-flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 8px;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: transform 180ms ease, background-color 180ms ease, border-color 180ms ease;
        }

        .theme-toggle:hover {
            transform: translateY(-1px);
        }

        .theme-toggle:focus-visible {
            outline: 2px solid var(--accent-dark);
            outline-offset: 2px;
        }

        .theme-icon {
            font-size: 1rem;
            line-height: 1;
        }

        /* ── Hero ── */
        .hero {
            position: relative;
            min-height: 100vh;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            padding-top: 80px;
            overflow: hidden;
        }

        .hero-bg-x {
            position: absolute;
            top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%;
            z-index: 0;
            pointer-events: none;
        }

        .slash-1 {
            position: absolute;
            width: 200%;
            height: 2px;
            top: 0;
            left: -50%;
            transform: rotate(35deg);
            transform-origin: center;
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, transparent, var(--highlight-dark), transparent);
            opacity: 0.8;
        }
        .slash-2 {
            position: absolute;
            width: 200%;
            height: 2px;
            top: 0;
            left: -50%;
            transform: rotate(-35deg);
            transform-origin: center;
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, transparent, var(--highlight-dark), transparent);
            opacity: 0.8;
        }

        #pattern-canvas {
            position: absolute;
            top: 0;
            left: 0;
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
            z-index: 0;
            opacity: 0.3;
        }

        .hero-content {
            position: relative;
            z-index: 2;
            width: 100%;
        }

        /* Hero: Two-column grid — stacked title (724b) + phone mockup (9bff) */
        .hero-layout {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: 1.2fr 1fr;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 40px;
            width: 100%;
        }

        /* Stacked title from design-724b */
        .hero-title-stack {
            font-family: var(--font-display);
            font-size: clamp(3.5rem, 7vw, 7rem);
            line-height: 0.85;
            font-weight: 700;
            text-transform: uppercase;
            letter-spacing: -0.03em;
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
        }

        .stack-layer {
            display: block;
            transition: transform 0.5s var(--ease-cinematic);
        }

        .stack-1 {
            color: transparent;
            -webkit-text-stroke: 1px var(--text-secondary);
            opacity: 0.5;
            transform: translateX(-20px);
        }

        .stack-2 {
            color: var(--accent-dark);
            opacity: 0.8;
        }

        .stack-3 {
            color: var(--text-dark);
            position: relative;
            z-index: 10;
        }

        .hero-sub {
            margin-top: 2rem;
            font-size: 1.25rem;
            color: var(--text-dark);
            opacity: 0.8;
            max-width: 600px;
            border-left: 2px solid var(--highlight-dark);
            padding-left: 20px;
        }

        .hero-actions {
            display: flex;
            gap: 20px;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            margin-top: 48px;
        }

        /* ── Phone Mockup ── */
        .mockup-container {
            position: relative;
            width: min(336px, 100%);
            height: 700px;
            margin-left: auto;
        }

        .phone-frame {
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
            background: var(--phone-frame-bg);
            border-radius: 46px;
            padding: 10px;
            box-shadow: 0 38px 90px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.46), 0 0 0 1px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.06);
            position: relative;
            transition: transform 220ms ease;
        }

        .phone-frame:hover {
            transform: translateY(-2px);
        }

        .phone-screen {
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
            background: var(--phone-screen-bg);
            border-radius: 36px;
            overflow: hidden;
            position: relative;
            border: 1px solid var(--phone-screen-border);
            padding: 12px 12px 18px;
        }

        .phone-status {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-between;
            align-items: center;
            font-size: 0.88rem;
            font-weight: 600;
            margin: 2px 8px 8px;
            color: var(--phone-text-primary);
            opacity: 0.9;
            position: relative;
            min-height: 28px;
            z-index: 5;
        }

        .phone-dynamic-island {
            position: absolute;
            left: 50%;
            top: 1px;
            transform: translateX(-50%);
            width: 122px;
            height: 24px;
            border-radius: 999px;
            background: #05060A;
        }

        .status-right {
            display: inline-flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 8px;
        }

        .status-icon-svg {
            width: 14px;
            height: 14px;
            display: inline-flex;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
            color: currentColor;
            opacity: 0.95;
        }

        .status-icon-svg svg {
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
            display: block;
        }

        .status-battery {
            width: 20px;
            height: 10px;
            border-radius: 2px;
            border: 1px solid color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 62%, transparent 38%);
            position: relative;
        }

        .status-battery::before {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            right: -3px;
            top: 2px;
            width: 2px;
            height: 4px;
            border-radius: 1px;
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 62%, transparent 38%);
        }

        .status-battery::after {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            top: 1px;
            left: 1px;
            width: 12px;
            height: 6px;
            border-radius: 1px;
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-dot-active) 65%, var(--phone-screen-bg) 35%);
        }

        .mockup-stage {
            position: absolute;
            inset: 46px 12px 18px;
            border-radius: 28px;
            transition: opacity 220ms ease;
        }

        .mockup-lock-state {
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
            align-items: center;
            text-align: center;
            opacity: 1;
            pointer-events: auto;
        }

        .mockup-unlock-state {
            opacity: 0;
            pointer-events: none;
            display: grid;
            place-items: center;
        }

        .mockup-vault-state {
            opacity: 0;
            pointer-events: none;
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
            gap: 10px;
            padding: 2px 2px 0;
            min-height: 0;
        }

        .phone-screen.mockup-unlocking .mockup-lock-state {
            opacity: 0;
            pointer-events: none;
        }

        .phone-screen.mockup-unlocking .mockup-unlock-state {
            opacity: 1;
        }

        .phone-screen.mockup-vault .mockup-lock-state,
        .phone-screen.mockup-vault .mockup-unlock-state {
            opacity: 0;
            pointer-events: none;
        }

        .phone-screen.mockup-vault .mockup-vault-state {
            opacity: 1;
            pointer-events: auto;
        }

        .lock-header {
            margin-top: 70px;
            display: grid;
            gap: 10px;
            place-items: center;
        }

        .lock-shield {
            width: 44px;
            height: 44px;
            border-radius: 12px;
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 10%, transparent 90%);
            display: grid;
            place-items: center;
            color: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 78%, transparent 22%);
            font-size: 1rem;
        }

        .lock-title {
            font-family: var(--font-body);
            font-size: 1.25rem;
            font-weight: 600;
            text-transform: none;
            letter-spacing: -0.01em;
            color: var(--phone-text-primary);
            margin: 0;
        }

        .pattern-lock-zone {
            width: 226px;
            height: 226px;
            position: relative;
            margin-top: 50px;
            margin-bottom: 8px;
        }

        .pattern-grid {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(5, 1fr);
            gap: 34px;
            position: relative;
            z-index: 5;
        }

        .grid-dot {
            width: 18px;
            height: 18px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            background: var(--phone-dot-inactive);
            border: 1px solid var(--phone-dot-border);
            transition: background-color 180ms ease, box-shadow 180ms ease;
        }

        .grid-dot.active {
            background: var(--phone-dot-active);
            border-color: transparent;
            box-shadow: 0 0 0 2px color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-dot-active) 30%, transparent 70%);
        }

        .pattern-svg {
            position: absolute;
            inset: 0;
            pointer-events: none;
            z-index: 4;
        }

        .pattern-line {
            stroke: var(--phone-line-color);
            stroke-width: 4;
            stroke-linecap: round;
            stroke-linejoin: round;
            fill: none;
            filter: drop-shadow(0 0 6px color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-dot-active) 52%, transparent 48%));
        }

        .pattern-cursor {
            fill: var(--phone-dot-active);
            filter: drop-shadow(0 0 3px color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-dot-active) 62%, transparent 38%));
            opacity: 0;
            transition: opacity 120ms ease;
        }

        .lock-actions {
            margin-top: auto;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
            display: grid;
            gap: 12px;
            place-items: center;
        }

        .lock-action {
            color: var(--phone-text-secondary);
            font-size: 0.95rem;
            font-weight: 500;
            opacity: 0.85;
        }

        .lock-action-primary {
            opacity: 1;
            color: var(--phone-action-primary);
        }

        .lock-action-secondary {
            opacity: 1;
            color: var(--phone-action-secondary);
        }

        .unlock-wrap {
            display: grid;
            gap: 14px;
            place-items: center;
            transform: translateY(-8px);
        }

        .unlock-pixel {
            width: 14px;
            height: 14px;
            border-radius: 2px;
            background: var(--phone-unlock-pixel-dim);
            animation: unlockPulse 1s infinite ease-in-out;
        }

        .unlock-text {
            color: var(--phone-text-secondary);
            font-size: 1.02rem;
            font-weight: 500;
        }

        .vault-app-header {
            width: 100%;
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: 34px 1fr 34px;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 8px;
            margin-top: 2px;
        }

        .vault-app-btn {
            width: 32px;
            height: 32px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            border: 1px solid color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 22%, transparent 78%);
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 8%, transparent 92%);
            color: var(--phone-text-primary);
            display: grid;
            place-items: center;
            font-size: 0.84rem;
        }

        .vault-app-title {
            margin: 0;
            color: var(--phone-text-primary);
            font-size: 0.92rem;
            font-weight: 600;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .vault-search-row {
            width: 100%;
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: 1fr 30px 30px;
            gap: 6px;
            align-items: center;
            margin-top: 2px;
        }

        .vault-search {
            height: 32px;
            border-radius: 9px;
            border: 1px solid color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 14%, transparent 86%);
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 6%, transparent 94%);
            color: var(--phone-text-secondary);
            font-size: 0.82rem;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            padding: 0 10px;
        }

        .vault-search-icon {
            margin-right: 6px;
            opacity: 0.7;
            font-size: 0.72rem;
        }

        .vault-chip {
            height: 30px;
            border-radius: 8px;
            border: 1px solid color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 18%, transparent 82%);
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 8%, transparent 92%);
            color: var(--phone-text-secondary);
            display: grid;
            place-items: center;
            font-size: 0.78rem;
        }

        .vault-section-label {
            color: var(--phone-text-secondary);
            font-size: 0.82rem;
            font-weight: 600;
            margin-top: 1px;
            padding-left: 2px;
            margin-bottom: 2px;
        }

        .vault-grid {
            width: 100%;
            flex: 1;
            min-height: 0;
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
            grid-template-rows: repeat(6, minmax(0, 1fr));
            gap: 2px;
            border-radius: 6px;
            overflow: hidden;
            align-content: stretch;
        }

        .vault-cell {
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 6%, transparent 94%);
            position: relative;
            border: 1px solid color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-text-primary) 8%, transparent 92%);
            overflow: hidden;
        }

        .vault-thumb {
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
            object-fit: cover;
            display: block;
            filter: saturate(1.08) contrast(1.02);
        }

        .vault-cell::after {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            inset: 0;
            background: linear-gradient(180deg, transparent 58%, rgba(8, 10, 20, 0.35) 100%);
            pointer-events: none;
        }

        .vault-cell-time {
            position: absolute;
            left: 3px;
            bottom: 3px;
            font-size: 0.54rem;
            color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.9);
            background: rgba(20, 22, 36, 0.75);
            border-radius: 3px;
            padding: 0 3px;
            z-index: 2;
        }

        .vault-fab {
            position: absolute;
            right: 10px;
            bottom: 12px;
            width: 44px;
            height: 44px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            border: none;
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-dot-active) 84%, white 16%);
            color: color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-screen-bg) 82%, black 18%);
            font-size: 1.8rem;
            line-height: 1;
            display: grid;
            place-items: center;
            box-shadow: 0 6px 14px color-mix(in srgb, var(--phone-dot-active) 32%, transparent 68%);
        }

        /* ── Trust Strip ── */
        .trust-strip {
            background: var(--highlight-light);
            padding: 24px 0;
            position: relative;
            z-index: 3;
            transform: skewY(-2deg);
            margin-top: -60px;
            border-top: 1px solid var(--surface-light);
            border-bottom: 1px solid var(--surface-light);
        }

        .trust-content {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-around;
            align-items: center;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            transform: skewY(2deg);
            gap: 20px;
        }

        .trust-item {
            font-family: var(--font-display);
            font-weight: 700;
            text-transform: uppercase;
            color: var(--surface-light);
            font-size: 1.1rem;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 10px;
        }

        .trust-item::before {
            content: '\00d7';
            color: var(--bg-dark);
            font-size: 1.5rem;
            font-weight: 900;
        }

        /* ── Features ── */
        .features {
            padding: 120px 0;
            background: var(--bg-light);
            color: var(--text-light);
            position: relative;
            clip-path: polygon(0 50px, 100% 0, 100% calc(100% - 50px), 0 100%);
        }

        .section-header {
            margin-bottom: 80px;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .section-header h2 {
            font-size: 3rem;
            color: var(--text-dark);
            margin-bottom: 16px;
        }

        .feature-grid {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr));
            gap: 30px;
        }

        .feature-card {
            background: var(--surface-light);
            padding: 40px;
            position: relative;
            clip-path: polygon(
                20px 0, 100% 0,
                100% calc(100% - 20px),
                calc(100% - 20px) 100%,
                0 100%, 0 20px
            );
            transition: transform 0.3s ease;
            box-shadow: 0 20px 40px rgba(32, 35, 60, 0.1);
        }

        .feature-card:hover {
            transform: translateY(-10px);
        }

        .feature-card::after {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            top: 0; right: 0;
            width: 40px;
            height: 40px;
            background: linear-gradient(to bottom left, var(--highlight-light) 50%, transparent 50%);
        }

        .feature-icon {
            font-size: 2rem;
            margin-bottom: 24px;
            color: var(--accent-light);
        }

        .feature-card h3 {
            font-size: 1.5rem;
            margin-bottom: 16px;
            color: var(--text-dark);
        }

        .feature-card p {
            color: var(--text-light);
            font-size: 1rem;
            line-height: 1.7;
        }

        /* ── Timeline ── */
        .timeline-section {
            padding: 120px 0;
            background: var(--bg-dark);
        }

        .timeline {
            position: relative;
            max-width: 800px;
            margin: 0 auto;
        }

        .timeline::before {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            left: 50%;
            top: 0;
            bottom: 0;
            width: 2px;
            background: rgba(255,255,255,0.1);
            transform: translateX(-50%);
        }

        .step {
            position: relative;
            margin-bottom: 80px;
            width: 50%;
        }

        .step:nth-child(odd) {
            left: 0;
            padding-right: 60px;
            text-align: right;
        }

        .step:nth-child(even) {
            left: 50%;
            padding-left: 60px;
        }

        .step-marker {
            position: absolute;
            top: 0;
            width: 20px;
            height: 20px;
            background: var(--bg-dark);
            border: 2px solid var(--highlight-dark);
            transform: rotate(45deg);
            z-index: 2;
        }

        .step:nth-child(odd) .step-marker {
            right: -11px;
        }

        .step:nth-child(even) .step-marker {
            left: -11px;
        }

        .step-number {
            font-family: var(--font-display);
            font-size: 4rem;
            color: rgba(255,255,255,0.05);
            font-weight: 800;
            position: absolute;
            top: -20px;
            line-height: 1;
        }

        .step:nth-child(odd) .step-number { right: 40px; }
        .step:nth-child(even) .step-number { left: 40px; }

        .step h3 {
            font-size: 1.8rem;
            margin-bottom: 12px;
            color: var(--text-dark);
            position: relative;
        }

        .step p {
            color: var(--accent-dark);
        }

        /* ── Security ── */
        .security-section {
            background: var(--surface-dark);
            padding: 100px 0;
            border-top: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.05);
        }

        .tech-specs {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
            gap: 60px;
            align-items: center;
        }

        .tech-diagram {
            background: var(--bg-dark);
            border: 1px solid var(--accent-light);
            padding: 40px;
            position: relative;
        }

        .tech-diagram::before, .tech-diagram::after {
            content: '';
            position: absolute;
            width: 20px;
            height: 20px;
            border-color: var(--highlight-light);
            border-style: solid;
            transition: all 0.5s;
        }
        .tech-diagram::before { top: -1px; left: -1px; border-width: 2px 0 0 2px; }
        .tech-diagram::after { bottom: -1px; right: -1px; border-width: 0 2px 2px 0; }

        .code-block {
            font-family: monospace;
            color: var(--accent-dark);
            line-height: 1.8;
            font-size: 0.9rem;
        }

        .code-key { color: var(--highlight-dark); }
        .code-val { color: var(--text-dark); }

        .tech-content h3 {
            font-size: 2.5rem;
            margin-bottom: 24px;
        }

        .tech-content ul {
            margin-top: 30px;
        }

        .tech-content li {
            margin-bottom: 16px;
            padding-left: 24px;
            position: relative;
            color: var(--text-dark);
        }

        .tech-content li::before {
            content: '/';
            color: var(--highlight-light);
            position: absolute;
            left: 0;
            font-weight: bold;
        }

        /* ── FAQ ── */
        .faq-section {
            padding: 120px 0;
            background: var(--bg-dark);
        }

        .faq-grid {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: 1fr;
            gap: 24px;
            max-width: 800px;
            margin: 0 auto;
        }

        .faq-item {
            border: 1px solid color-mix(in srgb, var(--text-dark) 12%, transparent 88%);
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--surface-dark) 58%, transparent 42%);
            transition: 0.3s;
        }

        .faq-item[open] {
            border-color: var(--highlight-light);
            background: var(--surface-dark);
        }

        .faq-summary {
            padding: 24px;
            cursor: pointer;
            font-family: var(--font-display);
            font-size: 1.2rem;
            font-weight: 500;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-between;
            align-items: center;
            list-style: none;
        }

        .faq-summary::-webkit-details-marker { display: none; }

        .faq-summary::after {
            content: '+';
            font-size: 1.5rem;
            color: var(--highlight-dark);
            transition: transform 0.3s;
        }

        .faq-item[open] .faq-summary::after {
            transform: rotate(45deg);
        }

        .faq-content {
            padding: 0 24px 24px 24px;
            color: var(--text-dark);
            opacity: 0.9;
        }

        /* ── Final CTA ── */
        .final-cta {
            padding: 140px 0;
            text-align: center;
            background: radial-gradient(circle at center, var(--accent-light) 0%, var(--bg-dark) 70%);
            position: relative;
            overflow: hidden;
        }

        .final-cta h2 {
            font-size: 4rem;
            margin-bottom: 30px;
            line-height: 1;
        }

        /* ── Footer ── */
        footer {
            background: color-mix(in srgb, var(--bg-dark) 82%, #07080D 18%);
            padding: 60px 0;
            font-size: 0.9rem;
            border-top: 1px solid color-mix(in srgb, var(--text-dark) 14%, transparent 86%);
        }

        .footer-content {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-between;
            align-items: center;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            gap: 20px;
        }

        .footer-links a {
            margin-left: 24px;
            color: var(--accent-dark);
        }
        .footer-links a:hover { color: var(--highlight-dark); }

        /* ── Grid Overlay ── */
        .grid-overlay {
            position: absolute;
            width: 100%; height: 100%;
            background-image: radial-gradient(var(--text-dark) 1px, transparent 1px);
            background-size: 40px 40px;
            opacity: 0.05;
            z-index: 1;
            pointer-events: none;
        }

        /* ── Responsive ── */
        @media (max-width: 900px) {
            .hero-layout {
                grid-template-columns: 1fr;
                text-align: center;
            }
            .hero-sub { border-left: none; padding-left: 0; margin-inline: auto; }
            .hero-actions { justify-content: center; }
            .mockup-container {
                margin: 40px auto;
                height: 660px;
            }
            .hero-title-stack { align-items: center; }
            .stack-1 { transform: translateX(0); }
        }

        @media (max-width: 768px) {
            .nav-inner {
                height: 74px;
            }
            .hero {
                min-height: auto;
                padding-top: 74px;
                padding-bottom: 40px;
            }
            .hero-layout {
                gap: 24px;
            }
            .hero-title-stack { font-size: clamp(2.5rem, 8vw, 4rem); }
            .hero-sub {
                margin-top: 1.35rem;
                font-size: 1.05rem;
                line-height: 1.5;
                max-width: 36ch;
            }
            .hero-actions {
                margin-top: 28px;
                width: 100%;
                gap: 12px;
            }
            .hero-actions .btn {
                width: 100%;
            }
            .timeline::before { left: 20px; }
            .step { width: 100%; padding-left: 60px !important; text-align: left !important; left: 0 !important; }
            .step:nth-child(odd) .step-marker, .step:nth-child(even) .step-marker { left: 9px; }
            .step-number { left: 60px !important; }
            .tech-specs { grid-template-columns: 1fr; }
            .nav-links { display: none; }
            .nav-cta {
                gap: 10px;
            }
            .nav-cta .btn {
                padding: 10px 16px !important;
                font-size: 0.82rem !important;
                letter-spacing: 0.03em;
            }
            .logo {
                font-size: 1.1rem;
            }
            .logo .logo-mark {
                width: 24px;
                height: 24px;
                border-radius: 7px;
            }
            .trust-content { flex-direction: column; }
            .theme-toggle #theme-label {
                display: none;
            }
            .mockup-container {
                width: min(100%, 340px);
                height: 560px;
                margin: 8px auto 0;
            }
            .pattern-lock-zone {
                width: 218px;
                height: 218px;
                margin-top: 42px;
            }
            .lock-title {
                font-size: 1.15rem;
            }
        }

        @keyframes loaderPulse {
            0% {
                opacity: 0.45;
                transform: scale(0.86);
            }
            50% {
                opacity: 1;
                transform: scale(1);
                background: var(--app-accent-dark);
            }
            100% {
                opacity: 0.45;
                transform: scale(0.86);
            }
        }

        @keyframes unlockPulse {
            0% {
                opacity: 0.42;
                transform: scale(0.86);
                background: var(--phone-unlock-pixel-dim);
            }
            50% {
                opacity: 1;
                transform: scale(1);
                background: var(--phone-unlock-pixel);
            }
            100% {
                opacity: 0.42;
                transform: scale(0.86);
                background: var(--phone-unlock-pixel-dim);
            }
        }

        @keyframes pulse {
            0% { opacity: 0.3; }
            50% { opacity: 0.6; }
            100% { opacity: 0.3; }
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>

    <!-- Header (from baseline design-4379) -->
    <header>
        <div class="container nav-inner">

        <!-- Trust Strip (from baseline design-4379) -->
        <section class="trust-strip">
            <div class="container">
                <div class="trust-content">
                    <div class="trust-item">No Accounts</div>
                    <div class="trust-item">No Personal Data</div>
                    <div class="trust-item">No Backdoors</div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>

        <!-- Features (from baseline design-4379) -->
        <section id="features" class="features">
            <div class="grid-overlay"></div>
            <div class="container">
                <div class="section-header">
                    <h2>Zero Knowledge. Zero Compromise.</h2>
                    <p style="color: var(--text-light); max-width: 600px; margin: 0 auto;">Your data never leaves your device unencrypted. We build privacy architecture, not data vacuums.</p>
                </div>

                <div class="feature-grid">
                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <div class="feature-icon">🔐</div>
                        <h3>Pattern Encryption</h3>
                        <p>Unlock with a geometric pattern. The pattern itself acts as the decryption key. No pattern, no data.</p>
                    </div>

                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <div class="feature-icon">🎭</div>
                        <h3>True Plausible Deniability</h3>
                        <p>Every pattern opens up a vault. You can set up as many decoy vaults as you want.</p>
                    </div>

                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <div class="feature-icon">🕶️</div>
                        <h3>Hidden Vaults</h3>
                        <p>Nobody can tell how many vaults exist on your device. Storage space is obfuscated to prevent analysis.</p>
                    </div>

                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <div class="feature-icon">🚨</div>
                        <h3>Duress Mode</h3>
                        <p>Set a “Duress Vault” that when opened instantly deletes all other vaults without any notice.</p>
                    </div>

                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <div class="feature-icon">☁️</div>
                        <h3>Encrypted iCloud Backup</h3>
                        <p>Optional off-site backup. Your data is encrypted locally <i>before</i> it ever touches Apple’s servers.</p>
                    </div>

                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <div class="feature-icon">🤝</div>
                        <h3>Secure Sharing</h3>
                        <p>Share vaults with others. Automatic synchronization, data export prevention, expiration and limit number of opens are all built in.</p>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>

        <!-- How It Works (from baseline design-4379) -->
        <section id="how-it-works" class="timeline-section">
            <div class="container">
                <div class="section-header">
                    <h2 style="color: var(--text-dark)">How It Works</h2>
                </div>
                <div class="timeline">
                    <div class="step">
                        <div class="step-marker"></div>
                        <div class="step-number">01</div>
                        <h3>Define Your Pattern</h3>
                        <p>Draw a unique geometric pattern to generate a high-entropy encryption key.<br>The key is created directly on your device’s Secure Enclave.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="step">
                        <div class="step-marker"></div>
                        <div class="step-number">02</div>
                        <h3>Load the Vault</h3>
                        <p>Import photos, documents, and notes. Files are instantly encrypted using AES-256 before being written to disk.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="step">
                        <div class="step-marker"></div>
                        <div class="step-number">03</div>
                        <h3>Lock & Vanish</h3>
                        <p>Close the app. The decryption keys are wiped from memory. Without the pattern, your files look like random noise.</p>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>

        <!-- Security (from baseline design-4379) -->
        <section id="security" class="security-section">
            <div class="container">
                <div class="tech-specs">
                    <div class="tech-content">
                        <h3>Security Architecture</h3>
                        <p style="color: var(--accent-dark); font-size: 1.1rem;">We don’t trust servers. We trust math.</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>AES-256-GCM</strong> file encryption</li>
                            <li><strong>Argon2id</strong> key derivation</li>
                            <li><strong>ChaCha20</strong> stream cipher for metadata</li>
                            <li><strong>Zero-Knowledge</strong> architecture</li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    <div class="tech-diagram">
                        <div class="code-block">
                            <span class="code-key">const</span> vaultConfig = {<br>
                              cipher: <span class="code-val">"AES-256-GCM"</span>,<br>
                              kdf: <span class="code-val">"Argon2id"</span>,<br>
                              iterations: <span class="code-val">128000</span>,<br>
                              salt: <span class="code-val">unique_per_vault</span>,<br>
                              cloud_sync: <span class="code-val">false</span> // default<br>
                            };<br><br>
                            <span style="color: var(--text-secondary)">// Server knows nothing.</span><br>
                            <span style="color: var(--text-secondary)">// Only your pattern decrypts.</span>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>

        <!-- FAQ (from baseline design-4379) -->
        <section id="faq" class="faq-section">
            <div class="container">
                <div class="section-header">
                    <h2 style="color: var(--text-dark)">Common Questions</h2>
                </div>
                <div class="faq-grid">
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">What happens if I forget my pattern?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>You are provided with a secret passphrase that recovers the vault. However if your forget that too, the data is lost. We do not store keys or have a backdoor to the data.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">Can Apple see my files?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>No. If you enable iCloud backup, we upload an encrypted blob. Apple hosts the file, but without your pattern key, it is mathematically impossible for them to read it.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">Do I need an account?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>Absolutely not. Vaultaire works right out of the box. No email, no phone number, no signup.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">Do you optimize my data?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>You have an option to store pictures and videos in optimized form, saving space and allowing for faster shares.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">How does sharing work?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>When you share a vault you are provided with a secret phrase that differs from the vault recovery phrase. Recipient can use it to obtain copy of the data. You control how long they keep access or how many times they can open the vault. If you add files, the data is synchronized automatically.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">Do you support folders?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>Not at this time. Instead we suggest you use different vaults to store different data.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">What kind of data can I store?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>There is no limitation. Any file can be stored and shared.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">How many vaults can I have?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>In the free version you are limited to 10 vaults. In paid it’s unlimited.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">How many files can I have per vault?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>There is no limit, however more files you add, bigger the vault and sharing becomes slower.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                    <details class="faq-item">
                        <summary class="faq-summary">Do you collect any analytical data?</summary>
                        <div class="faq-content">
                            <p>If you give us permission (can be revoked at any time), we collect bugs, crashes and basic analytical information. There are no accounts, identity or any personal data attached. We have no idea who you are or what you are using Vaultaire for.</p>
                        </div>
                    </details>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
    </main>

    <!-- Footer (from baseline design-4379) -->
    <footer>
        <div class="container footer-content">
            <div class="footer-brand">
                <h4 style="color: var(--text-dark)">Vaultaire</h4>
                <p style="color: var(--text-secondary); font-size: 0.8rem; margin-top: 8px;">© 2026 Wraxle LLC</p>
            </div>
            <div class="footer-links">
                <a href="index.html">Home</a>
                <a href="manifesto/index.html">Manifesto</a>
                <a href="privacy/index.html">Privacy Policy</a>

    <script>
        (function () {
            const root = document.documentElement;
            const themeToggle = document.getElementById('theme-toggle');
            const themeIcon = document.getElementById('theme-icon');
            const themeLabel = document.getElementById('theme-label');
            const preferred = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
            const savedTheme = localStorage.getItem('vaultaire-theme');
            const hasUserOverride = savedTheme === 'dark' || savedTheme === 'light';

            const toRgba = (hex, alpha) => {
                const normalized = hex.replace('#', '').trim();
                const fullHex = normalized.length === 3
                    ? normalized.split('').map(ch => ch + ch).join('')
                    : normalized;

                if (!/^[0-9a-fA-F]{6}$/.test(fullHex)) {
                    return `rgba(204, 195, 248, ${alpha})`;
                }

                const r = parseInt(fullHex.slice(0, 2), 16);
                const g = parseInt(fullHex.slice(2, 4), 16);
                const b = parseInt(fullHex.slice(4, 6), 16);
                return `rgba(${r}, ${g}, ${b}, ${alpha})`;
            };

            function setTheme(theme, persist) {
                root.dataset.theme = theme;
                const isDark = theme === 'dark';
                themeIcon.textContent = isDark ? '☀︎' : '☽';
                themeLabel.textContent = isDark ? 'Light' : 'Dark';
                themeToggle.setAttribute('aria-pressed', String(!isDark));
                themeToggle.setAttribute('aria-label', `Switch to ${isDark ? 'light' : 'dark'} mode`);
                if (persist) {
                    localStorage.setItem('vaultaire-theme', theme);
                }
                updateCanvasTheme();
            }

            const canvas = document.getElementById('pattern-canvas');
            const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
            let width = 0;
            let height = 0;
            let bgDots = [];
            let accentColor = '#CCC3F8';
            let accentTrailColor = 'rgba(204, 195, 248, 0.4)';

            function updateCanvasTheme() {
                const styles = getComputedStyle(root);
                accentColor = styles.getPropertyValue('--accent-dark').trim() || '#CCC3F8';
                accentTrailColor = toRgba(accentColor, 0.35);
            }

            setTheme(hasUserOverride ? savedTheme : (preferred.matches ? 'dark' : 'light'), false);

            themeToggle.addEventListener('click', () => {
                const next = root.dataset.theme === 'dark' ? 'light' : 'dark';
                setTheme(next, true);
            });

            preferred.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
                if (!localStorage.getItem('vaultaire-theme')) {
                    setTheme(event.matches ? 'dark' : 'light', false);
                }
            });

            function resize() {
                width = canvas.width = canvas.parentElement.offsetWidth;
                height = canvas.height = canvas.parentElement.offsetHeight;
                initDots();
            }

            function initDots() {
                bgDots = [];
                const spacing = 110;
                const rows = Math.ceil(height / spacing);
                const cols = Math.ceil(width / spacing);

                for (let i = 0; i < cols; i += 1) {
                    for (let j = 0; j < rows; j += 1) {
                        bgDots.push({
                            x: i * spacing + (Math.random() * 24),
                            y: j * spacing + (Math.random() * 24)
                        });
                    }
                }
            }

            let drawingPath = false;
            function drawRandomPattern() {
                if (drawingPath || bgDots.length === 0) return;
                drawingPath = true;

                const startIndex = Math.floor(Math.random() * bgDots.length);
                const pathLength = 4 + Math.floor(Math.random() * 3);
                const start = bgDots[startIndex];
                let current = start;

                ctx.strokeStyle = accentTrailColor;
                ctx.lineWidth = 2;
                ctx.beginPath();
                ctx.moveTo(start.x, start.y);

                for (let i = 0; i < pathLength; i += 1) {
                    const next = bgDots[Math.floor(Math.random() * bgDots.length)];
                    const dist = Math.hypot(next.x - current.x, next.y - current.y);
                    if (dist < 200 && dist > 36) {
                        ctx.lineTo(next.x, next.y);
                        current = next;
                    }
                }
                ctx.stroke();

                setTimeout(() => {
                    drawingPath = false;
                }, 540);
            }

            function draw() {
                ctx.clearRect(0, 0, width, height);
                ctx.fillStyle = accentColor;
                bgDots.forEach((dot) => {
                    ctx.beginPath();
                    ctx.arc(dot.x, dot.y, 1.4, 0, Math.PI * 2);
                    ctx.fill();
                });

                if (Math.random() > 0.95) {
                    drawRandomPattern();
                }

                requestAnimationFrame(draw);
            }

            window.addEventListener('resize', resize);
            resize();
            draw();

            const dots = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.grid-dot'));
            const pathEl = document.getElementById('drawing-path');
            const cursorEl = document.getElementById('drawing-cursor');
            const svgEl = document.getElementById('mockup-svg');
            const lockZone = document.getElementById('pattern-lock-zone');
            const phoneScreen = document.querySelector('.phone-screen');
            const mockupTimeEl = document.getElementById('mockup-time');

            const sequences = [
                [0, 5, 6, 7, 12, 17, 16, 15, 20, 21, 22, 23, 24]
            ];
            let sequenceIndex = 0;
            let nodeCenters = [];

            const sleep = (ms) => new Promise((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, ms));

            function updateMockupTime() {
                const now = new Date();
                const hour = ((now.getHours() + 11) % 12) + 1;
                const minute = String(now.getMinutes()).padStart(2, '0');
                mockupTimeEl.textContent = `${hour}:${minute}`;
            }

            function scheduleMockupMinuteTick() {
                updateMockupTime();
                const now = new Date();
                const msUntilNextMinute = ((60 - now.getSeconds()) * 1000) - now.getMilliseconds();
                setTimeout(scheduleMockupMinuteTick, Math.max(200, msUntilNextMinute));
            }

            scheduleMockupMinuteTick();

            function computeNodeCenters() {
                const baseRect = lockZone.getBoundingClientRect();
                svgEl.setAttribute('viewBox', `0 0 ${baseRect.width} ${baseRect.height}`);
                svgEl.setAttribute('width', `${baseRect.width}`);
                svgEl.setAttribute('height', `${baseRect.height}`);
                nodeCenters = dots.map((dot) => {
                    const rect = dot.getBoundingClientRect();
                    return {
                        x: rect.left - baseRect.left + (rect.width / 2),
                        y: rect.top - baseRect.top + (rect.height / 2)
                    };
                });
            }

            function setPath(points) {
                if (points.length === 0) {
                    pathEl.setAttribute('d', '');
                    cursorEl.style.opacity = '0';
                    return;
                }
                const commands = points.map((point, idx) => {
                    const cmd = idx === 0 ? 'M' : 'L';
                    return `${cmd} ${point.x.toFixed(2)} ${point.y.toFixed(2)}`;
                });
                pathEl.setAttribute('d', commands.join(' '));
                const tail = points[points.length - 1];
                cursorEl.setAttribute('cx', tail.x.toFixed(2));
                cursorEl.setAttribute('cy', tail.y.toFixed(2));
                cursorEl.style.opacity = '1';
            }

            function animateSegment(stablePoints, fromPoint, toPoint, durationMs) {
                return new Promise((resolve) => {
                    const startedAt = performance.now();

                    function tick(now) {
                        const progress = Math.min(1, (now - startedAt) / durationMs);
                        const x = fromPoint.x + ((toPoint.x - fromPoint.x) * progress);
                        const y = fromPoint.y + ((toPoint.y - fromPoint.y) * progress);
                        setPath([...stablePoints, { x, y }]);

                        if (progress < 1) {
                            requestAnimationFrame(tick);
                        } else {
                            resolve();
                        }
                    }

                    requestAnimationFrame(tick);
                });
            }

            async function runSequence(sequence) {
                dots.forEach((dot) => dot.classList.remove('active'));
                setPath([]);
                const points = [];
                computeNodeCenters();
                await sleep(250);

                if (sequence.length === 0) return;

                const firstNode = sequence[0];
                dots[firstNode].classList.add('active');
                points.push(nodeCenters[firstNode]);
                setPath(points);

                for (let i = 1; i < sequence.length; i += 1) {
                    const prevPoint = nodeCenters[sequence[i - 1]];
                    const nextPoint = nodeCenters[sequence[i]];
                    const stablePoints = points.slice(0);
                    await animateSegment(stablePoints, prevPoint, nextPoint, 170);

                    dots[sequence[i]].classList.add('active');
                    points.push(nextPoint);
                    setPath(points);
                }

                await sleep(220);
                phoneScreen.classList.add('mockup-unlocking');
                await sleep(980);
                phoneScreen.classList.remove('mockup-unlocking');
                phoneScreen.classList.add('mockup-vault');
                await sleep(5000);
                phoneScreen.classList.remove('mockup-vault');

                dots.forEach((dot) => dot.classList.remove('active'));
                setPath([]);
                await sleep(430);
            }

            (async function animatePatternLoop() {
                await sleep(700);
                while (true) {
                    const sequence = sequences[sequenceIndex];
                    await runSequence(sequence);
                    sequenceIndex = (sequenceIndex + 1) % sequences.length;
                }
            })();
        })();
    </script>

</body></html>

Vaultaire
Home Features How It Works Security Manifesto FAQ
Get App

The case for Vaultaire

Privacy apps have a fatal flaw: they look like privacy apps. This manifesto explains why Vaultaire was built to remove proof, not add another lock screen.

Privacy apps have a fatal flaw: they look like privacy apps.

A locked folder announces it's locked. A hidden gallery called “Calculator+” fools no one who's looking. Every “secure” photo vault on your iPhone shares the same problem: it proves you have something to hide.

When someone forces you to unlock your phone, whether that's a border agent, an abusive partner, or an authoritarian government, they see the app, they see the lock, and they don't stop until you open it.

Vaultaire doesn't hide your files behind a lock. It makes them cease to exist.

How encrypted photo storage should actually work

Draw a pattern on the grid. A vault opens with your private photos, videos, and documents, each file individually encrypted with AES-256-GCM using hardware-backed keys from Apple's Secure Enclave. Draw a different pattern, and a completely different vault opens. Different files, different encryption keys, different everything.

Enter the wrong pattern? No error message. No “incorrect password.” Just an empty vault. There is no observable difference between “wrong” and “empty.”

Every vault sits inside a pre-allocated block of encrypted noise. Whether you've stored zero files or five hundred, the data on disk looks identical. Forensic tools can't tell the difference. There is nothing to find because there is nothing that looks like something to find.

This is not a lock on a door. It's a wall where the door used to be.

Why zero-knowledge architecture matters

Most photo vault apps put a PIN screen in front of unencrypted files. If someone connects your phone to a computer, the files are right there, completely readable. That's not security. That's a curtain.

Vaultaire was built around a single principle: no one, not us, not Apple, not a forensic examiner, can prove your files exist. Privacy is not something we bolted on after the fact. It's how the app works at every layer.

No accounts. No email, no phone number, no identity to tie back to you. Nothing to subpoena.

No cloud dependency. Your files never leave your device unless you explicitly choose encrypted iCloud backup or encrypted vault sharing. Even then, the server only sees noise.

No biometrics. Face ID and fingerprints can be compelled by law enforcement. A pattern in your head can't be extracted. We left biometrics out on purpose.

No “forgot password.” No server knows your pattern. No email reset. No backdoor. A 12-word recovery phrase exists for those who want it, stored only on your device. There is no way in for anyone but you.

Your pattern goes through 600,000 rounds of PBKDF2 to derive a 256-bit encryption key. That key lives only in memory and gets wiped the moment the app locks. We never see it. We can't recover it. That's the point.

Who it's for

Journalists protecting sources where phone searches are routine. Activists carrying documentation under government surveillance. Domestic abuse survivors keeping evidence secure on a device they know is being monitored. Travelers crossing borders where device inspection is mandatory. Attorneys with privileged materials on personal phones.

And anyone who gets that privacy isn't about having something to hide. It's about having something worth protecting.

The duress vault

Designate any vault as a duress trigger. When that pattern is drawn under coercion, every other vault is silently and permanently destroyed. The duress vault opens normally. The person watching sees cooperation and an ordinary-looking vault with a few harmless photos. They have no way to know that anything else ever existed.

No other encrypted vault app does this.

What we won't build

We won't add biometric unlock, because it can be legally compelled. We won't add cloud-dependent storage, because it creates a target for subpoenas and breaches. We won't add analytics that track how you use the app. We won't add a backdoor dressed up as account recovery. We won't weaken the architecture for convenience.

Every decision in Vaultaire comes back to one thing: your private files stay yours, under any circumstance.

Vaultaire is a private, encrypted photo and file vault for iPhone. It does not collect, transmit, or store any personal information. All AES-256-GCM encryption is performed locally on your device using Apple's Secure Enclave. We cannot access your files, your patterns, or your recovery phrases, by design.

Vaultaire

Home Features How It Works Security Manifesto FAQ
Get App

Privacy Policy

Last updated: February 13, 2026

Overview

Vaultaire is a private photo vault app designed with zero-knowledge architecture. Your files are encrypted on your device using a key derived from your pattern. We cannot access, view, or recover your data.

Data We Do Not Collect

  • Your photos, videos, or files — all data is encrypted on-device and never leaves your phone unencrypted.
  • Your pattern or encryption keys — these are derived locally and wiped from memory when you lock the app.
  • Your recovery phrase — stored only in your device's Secure Enclave.
  • Your name, email, or account information — Vaultaire requires no account to use.

Analytics (Opt-In Only)

During onboarding, you are asked whether you'd like to help improve Vaultaire by sharing anonymous usage data. This is entirely optional. If you consent:

  • TelemetryDeck collects anonymous usage signals (e.g., which screens are visited, feature adoption). No device identifiers, IP addresses, or personal data are collected. Data cannot be traced back to you. TelemetryDeck's privacy policy.
  • Sentry collects crash reports and performance data to help us fix bugs. Crash reports may include device model, OS version, and stack traces. No personal content is ever included. Sentry's privacy policy.

You can change your analytics preference at any time in the app's Settings.

iCloud Backup

If you enable iCloud Backup in settings, your encrypted vault data is uploaded to your personal iCloud account. The data remains encrypted with your pattern-derived key. We do not have access to your iCloud account or the uploaded data. Apple's iCloud terms apply to this storage.

Vault Sharing

When you share a vault via link, the encrypted data is transmitted through Apple's CloudKit infrastructure. The share link contains the decryption phrase in the URL fragment (after the #), which never reaches our servers. Only the intended recipient with the full link can decrypt the shared vault.

In-App Purchases

Vaultaire offers a premium subscription through Apple's App Store. All purchase transactions are handled by Apple. We do not collect or store your payment information. Apple's terms and privacy policy govern these transactions.

Third-Party Services

  • Apple CloudKit — used for vault sharing and iCloud backup (encrypted data only)
  • Apple StoreKit — used for in-app purchase processing
  • TelemetryDeck — anonymous analytics (opt-in only)
  • Sentry — crash reporting (opt-in only)

Children's Privacy

Vaultaire does not knowingly collect any personal information from children under 13. The app does not require an account or collect any personal data.

Changes to This Policy

We may update this policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date.

Contact

If you have questions about this privacy policy, contact us at support@vaultaire.app.

Vaultaire

Terms of Use

Last updated: February 13, 2026

Acceptance of Terms

By downloading, installing, or using Vaultaire (“the App”), you agree to these Terms of Use. If you do not agree, do not use the App.

Description of Service

Vaultaire is an on-device encrypted photo and file vault for iOS. The App encrypts your data locally using a pattern-based key derivation system. We do not operate servers that store your data (aside from optional iCloud backup to your personal Apple account and optional vault sharing via Apple CloudKit).

Your Responsibilities

  • Remember your pattern. Your encryption key is derived from your pattern. If you forget your pattern and have not saved your recovery phrase, your data cannot be recovered by anyone, including us.
  • Save your recovery phrase. During setup, you are given a recovery phrase. Store it securely. It is the only way to recover your vault if you forget your pattern.
  • Lawful use. You agree to use the App only for lawful purposes and in accordance with all applicable laws.
  • Content responsibility. You are solely responsible for the content you store in the App.

No Data Recovery

Vaultaire uses zero-knowledge encryption. We do not have access to your encryption keys, patterns, or recovery phrases. If you lose your pattern and recovery phrase, your data is permanently unrecoverable. We cannot assist with data recovery under any circumstances.

Subscriptions and Purchases

  • Vaultaire offers a free tier with limited storage and a premium subscription (“Vaultaire Pro”) for expanded features.
  • Subscriptions are billed through Apple's App Store and are subject to Apple's terms and refund policies.
  • You can manage or cancel your subscription in your iPhone's Settings > Apple Account > Subscriptions.
  • Subscription prices may vary by region and are displayed in the App before purchase.

Vault Sharing

  • When you share a vault, you grant the recipient access to the encrypted data for the duration and under the conditions you specify (expiration, open limits).
  • Share links contain the decryption key in the URL fragment. Anyone with the full link can access the shared vault. Share links responsibly.
  • You are responsible for the content you share. Do not share illegal, harmful, or unauthorized content.

Duress Mode

Vaultaire includes a duress feature that permanently destroys vault data when a designated pattern is entered. This action is irreversible. We are not liable for data loss resulting from the use of this feature, whether intentional or accidental.

Intellectual Property

The App, including its design, code, and branding, is the property of the developer. You are granted a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable license to use the App for personal purposes in accordance with these terms.

Disclaimer of Warranties

The App is provided “as is” without warranty of any kind. We do not warrant that the App will be uninterrupted, error-free, or that defects will be corrected. While we use industry-standard encryption (AES-256-GCM, PBKDF2), no security system is absolute. Use the App at your own risk.

Limitation of Liability

To the maximum extent permitted by law, we shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from your use of the App, including but not limited to data loss, unauthorized access, or inability to access your data.

Changes to Terms

We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Changes take effect when posted on this page. Continued use of the App after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

Contact

For questions about these terms, contact us at support@vaultaire.app.

Vaultaire vs Keepsafe

Keepsafe requires an account and stores your photos on their servers. Vaultaire never asks for an email and encrypts everything locally on your device.

Feature Comparison

Keepsafe by KeepSafe Software has 369K ratings and a 4.7-star average. Here is how it compares to Vaultaire across 17 security and privacy features.

Feature Vaultaire Keepsafe
AES-256-GCM encryptionFile-level authenticated encryption ✓ ✗
Secure Enclave hardware keysKeys never leave the chip ✓ ✗
Pattern lock (not PIN)Visual pattern derives encryption key ✓ ✗
Multiple independent vaultsSeparate encrypted containers ✓ ✓
Duress vault (destroy on trigger)Plausible deniability under coercion ✓ ✗
Zero-knowledge architectureNo server, no account, no telemetry ✓ ✗
Encrypted iCloud backupBackup stays encrypted end-to-end ✓ Cloud backup (their servers)
Encrypted vault sharingShare vaults without exposing keys ✓ ✗
Recovery phraseBIP-39 mnemonic for key recovery ✓ ✗
No biometrics (by design)Biometrics can be compelled; patterns cannot ✓ ✗
Photos, Videos & Files supportAll media types plus documents ✓ ✓
Media optimization (HEIC/HEVC)Preserves efficient Apple formats ✓ ✗
Free tier availableUsable without payment ✓ ✓
No ads in free tierClean experience at every level ✓ ✗
Share sheet importImport from any app via iOS share sheet ✓ ✓
Camera captureShoot directly into the vault ✓ ✓
Offline-only by defaultNo network calls unless you opt in ✓ ✗

The Account Requirement Paradox

Keepsafe asks you to create an account with your email address before you can use the app. Think about that for a moment: a privacy app that requires personally identifiable information before it will protect your files. Your email is now linked to the fact that you use a photo-hiding app, stored on Keepsafe's servers alongside your usage metadata.

Vaultaire has no account system. There is no sign-up screen, no email field, no password to create. You draw a pattern, and the app derives an encryption key. The app does not know who you are, and it does not need to.

Cloud Dependency Risks

Keepsafe's cloud backup feature stores your photos on their infrastructure. This creates multiple risk vectors: server breaches expose your files, service outages block access, and company shutdown means your data could disappear entirely. Their "military-grade encryption" claim is difficult to verify because the encryption happens on their servers, not your device.

Vaultaire's backup goes through iCloud, but the files are encrypted on your device before upload. Apple transports encrypted blobs -- they cannot read them, and neither can anyone who compromises iCloud. If you stop using Vaultaire, your recovery phrase lets you decrypt everything locally.

Pricing vs Value

Keepsafe Premium costs $9.99/month or $23.99/year. For that price, you get cloud storage on their servers, ad removal, and some additional organizational features. The core security model does not change between free and premium -- both tiers use account-based authentication rather than local encryption.

Vaultaire Pro costs $1.99/month, $9.99/year, or $29.99 lifetime. The free tier already includes AES-256-GCM encryption -- the same cryptographic standard used by the paid tier. Pro adds unlimited vaults, the duress vault, iCloud backup, and sharing. The security architecture is identical at every price point.

Data Ownership

When your photos live on Keepsafe's servers, you are trusting a third party with your most private files. Their privacy policy governs what they can do with your data. If they are acquired, pivot their business model, or receive a legal request, your files are in someone else's hands.

Vaultaire files never leave your device unless you explicitly enable iCloud backup -- and even then, they are encrypted before upload. There is no third-party server, no terms of service governing your files, and no entity that can access your data without your pattern. You own the encryption keys. You own the data.

What Keepsafe Users Complain About

Common complaints from App Store reviews, and how Vaultaire addresses each one.

Account required - privacy app needs my email?

"Why does a privacy app need my email address? That defeats the entire purpose."

Vaultaire approach: No account, no email, no phone number. You draw a pattern, and the app works. Zero personally identifiable information collected.

Photos lost when server had issues

"Their servers went down and I couldn't access my photos for two days. Some never came back."

Vaultaire approach: All files are stored locally on your device. No server dependency means no server outages. iCloud backup is optional and encrypted end-to-end.

Expensive subscription

"$9.99 a month for a photo vault? That's $120 a year to hide photos."

Vaultaire approach: Pro is $1.99/month or $9.99/year. The lifetime option at $29.99 costs less than three months of Keepsafe Premium. The free tier includes real encryption.

Ads everywhere in free version

"Full-screen ads every time I open an album. It's a privacy app running ad trackers."

Vaultaire approach: No ads at any tier. No ad SDKs in the binary. No network requests to advertising servers. The app is offline by default.

Cloud-dependent means my data is on their servers

"I just realized all my 'private' photos are sitting on some company's server. How is that private?"

Vaultaire approach: Files are encrypted on-device and stay on-device. If you use iCloud backup, files are encrypted before leaving your phone. No third-party server ever holds your unencrypted data.

No Account. No Cloud. No Compromise.

Vaultaire encrypts locally with AES-256-GCM, requires no account, and starts at free.

Most photo vault apps hide your files behind a PIN screen. Vaultaire encrypts them with AES-256-GCM so they can't be read even if someone pulls the raw data off your device. See how we compare.

Vaultaire vs Private Photo Vault

Private Photo Vault puts a PIN screen in front of your photos. Vaultaire encrypts every file with AES-256-GCM so even raw disk access reveals nothing.

Feature Comparison

Private Photo Vault by Legendary Software Labs has 998K ratings and a 4.7-star average. Here is how it compares to Vaultaire across 17 security and privacy features.
